intro: Ficinia zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher's fig, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. It produces small, edible fruits that are favored by certain bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
